description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cpo8q","text":"This protocol describes collecting samples for Dissolved Organic Carbon (DOC) analysis. Dissolved organic carbon is operationally defined as the material that passes through a filter with a known pore size. Part numbers are in the materials section for GF/F filters (nominally 0.7 um) and PTFE Omnipore filters (we use 0.2 um for this protocol, many sizes are available).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2nkdu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ae5so","text":"This protocol assumes you are using Niskin bottles to sample water at a desired depth.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b4sda","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"mouv","text":"40 ml EPA vials with Teflon-lined septa, e.g., Fisher part number 03-339-14A","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ad0k8","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bm0vr","text":"Teflon-lined septa are also required for the autosampler. Septa are not reusable, but the outer ring holding the septa onto the vial can be reused.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f6me6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20prr","text":"Part numbers for the Telfon-lined septa: from Thermo (B7995-24) or from Restek (24694)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gppp","text":"The open top caps are 24-400 caps, come from Thermo (B7807) or (5310-24W-SB)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6r22h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85sck","text":"Polycarbonate 47 mm filter rigs, part number #1119","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1pnfh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5o92","text":"Whatman GF/F filters, part number 1825-047","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0fnv","text":"or","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1epu7","text":"Millipore Sigma Omnipore hydrophilic PTFE membranes, part number JHWP04700 (0.45 um pore size) or JGWP04700 (0.2 um pore size)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f49sc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5v9d","text":"Silicone tubing to connect polycarbonate filter holders to the Niskin bottle (if sampling from CTD/rosette)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1a0jt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dmsd","text":"Pipet for   of volume and tips.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":10,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6cmtq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bll3f","text":"Tweezers for filters","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hu23","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bubv","text":"Concentrated hydrochloric acid (12 M) in glass bottle. Do not use HCl in plastic bottles. This means purchasing smaller glass bottles of HCl or purchasing trace-metal grade HCl in Teflon bottles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5oig0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"95fiu","text":"Nitrile gloves","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5c7qp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tt13","text":"TOC analyzer: our lab uses a Shimadzu TOC-VCSH total organic carbon analyzer with a TNM-1 module for total nitrogen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bt4g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"40","error":false,"guid":"15F59BD0A8CA11EBBD9073B456E8C512","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
public_fork_note: Added part numbers for Teflon-lined septa and open top caps

status.info: We use this protocol and itâ€™s working

steps.section: Collecting samples for Total Organic Carbon (TOC) analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bkbet","text":"The glass vials need to be combusted before use. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Collecting samples for Total Organic Carbon (TOC) analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ufbm","text":"Set aside the caps that were sent with the vials because they cannot be combusted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Collecting samples for Total Organic Carbon (TOC) analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1r4l8","text":"Wrap packs of glass vials in foil prior to combusting them.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Collecting samples for Total Organic Carbon (TOC) analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"88oqa","text":"Combust the glass vials at   for at least  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":27,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":42,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8C3F7360A9B811EBAE7D0A58A9FEAC02","id":"49463","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"450","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":14400,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8C3F745FA9B811EBAE7D0A58A9FEAC02","id":"80128","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"450","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Collecting samples for Total Organic Carbon (TOC) analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cf8f9","text":"If you are using GF/F filters, they also need to be combusted before use. It is easiest to combust them in batches of ~25 in foil-wrapped glass petri dishes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1sqa2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3nh5b","text":"Omnipore filters cannot be combusted and are used as is from the package.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Collecting samples for Total Organic Carbon (TOC) analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5nfj1","text":"Use electrical tape or lab tape to label the glass vials. Do not use too much tape as that causes problems with inserting the vials into the autosampler. We prefer 1/2 inch label tape, placed towards the top of the vial. Be sure to wrap the tape all the way around the vial in order to prevent the labels from falling off during sample processing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Collecting samples for Total Organic Carbon (TOC) analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8afkq","text":"In the field, use gloves for all sampling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Collecting samples for Total Organic Carbon (TOC) analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3i01g","text":"Place one filter (GF/F or Omnipore) into the polycarbonate filter holder. Make sure the filter is centered in the holder before tightening the two halves of the filter holder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Collecting samples for Total Organic Carbon (TOC) analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fb9eg","text":"Attach the filter holder to the Niskin using the silicone tubing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Collecting samples for Total Organic Carbon (TOC) analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ov4g","text":"Open the top valve on the Niskin and press in the sampling nipple to begin the flow of water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Collecting samples for Total Organic Carbon (TOC) analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"drcdp","text":"As needed, vent air out of the filter holder using the valve on the top of the filter holder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Collecting samples for Total Organic Carbon (TOC) analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8bi8d","text":"Rinse the 40 ml glass vials 3x with sample water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Collecting samples for Total Organic Carbon (TOC) analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"71n3k","text":"After rinsing, fill each vial up to the shoulder with the sample ( ).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":66,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"28rpv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"40","error":false,"guid":"33245730A8C711EBAFD23D1E09D9997D","id":"89378","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

steps.section: Collecting samples for Total Organic Carbon (TOC) analysis
Collecting samples for Total Organic Carbon (TOC) analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9qq6","text":"Store the acidified samples at   in racks/boxes that keep vials from knocking into each other.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":31,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"bievl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"anje8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6e0v6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3E769850A8C711EBAFD23D1E09D9997D","id":"49464","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7u2ea","text":"One good idea is to process several MilliQ samples in the field the same way the water samples are processed to test for potential contamination in the field.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
